thread.title: See Foo Fighter Chris Shiflett's Frenetic Video for 'West Coast Town'
thread.title_full: See Foo Fighter Chris Shiflett's Frenetic Video for 'West Coast Town'

title: See Foo Fighter Chris Shiflett's Frenetic Video for 'West Coast Town'
text:
Earlier this month, Chris Shiflett released "West Coast Town," the title track and first single off his forthcoming country album. Now, the Foo Fighters guitarist has shared a fast-paced new video for the song. Related Hear Foo Fighters' Chris Shiflett's New Country Song 'West Coast Town' Bakersfield-meets-cowpunk barn-burner is the title track to Shiflett's upcoming album 
The clip features quick cuts of Shiflett singing and strumming his guitar on a beach, hanging out on an old-school boardwalk and exploring a small town. The imagery suits the lyrics of the hardscrabble country song, in which the Santa Barbara native sings of growing up in California " back before they chased the working class out ." 
For West Coast Town – his third solo effort – Shiflett recruited Nashville all-star Dave Cobb, the producer behind such albums as Jason Isbell's Something More Than Free and Chris Stapleton's Traveller . The pair recorded the album at Nashville's famed RCA Studio A. 
In addition to maintaining a solo career, Shiflett also hosts the country and Americana podcast Walking the Floor . The most recent episode features a candid conversation with Americana pioneer Lucinda Williams. 
West Coast Town is out April 14th. Shiflett will kick off a short run of tour dates on March 21st in Portland, Oregon. More News
